quote: Hold hook and line, say down, down, dogs! Down, Fates!
This is a stem of that victorious stock, and let us fear the native mightiness and fate of him.
Why, this it is! See, see! Have been begging sixteen years in court, am yet a courtier beggarly, nor could come pat betwixt too early and too late for any suit of pounds; and you--O, fate!
If thou read this, Caesar, thou mayest live; if not, the Fates with traitors do contrive.
What should be spoken here, where our fate, hid in an auger hole, may rush and seize us?
Take my defiance; die, perish. Might but my bending down reprieve thee from thy fate, it should proceed.
Then fate o'errules, that, one man holding troth, million fail, confounding oath on oath.

Talk not of Master lancelet, father, for the young gentleman, according to Fates and Destinies, and such odd sayings, the sisters Three, and such branches of learning, is indeed deceased, or, as you would say in plain terms, gone to heaven.
If it were now to die, 'Twere now to be most happy, for fear my soul hath her content so absolute that not another comfort like to this succeeds in unknown fate.
--Live, and make us weep to hear your fate, fair creature, rare as you seem to be.
The malignancy of my fate might perhaps distemper yours.
Thy fates open their hands. Let thy blood and spirit embrace them.
